skill.name: multi-agent-patterns
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "design multi-agent system", "implement supervisor pattern", "create swarm architecture", "coordinate multiple agents", or mentions multi-agent patterns, context isolation, agent handoffs, sub-agents, or parallel agent execution.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "design multi-agent system", "implement supervisor p...
skill.author: ChakshuGautam

security_audit.summary: Educational documentation skill for multi-agent AI patterns. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES: markdown code fences misidentified as shell execution, table syntax flagged as crypto algorithms, and standard coordination patterns flagged as reconnaissance. No malicious code, credential access, or data exfiltration patterns present.

content.value_statement: Single AI agents hit context limits when handling complex tasks. This skill teaches proven patterns to distribute work across multiple agents while maintaining coordination and avoiding common failure modes.
actual_capabilities: Explains three core multi-agent patterns: supervisor, peer-to-peer, and hierarchical
Provides Python implementation examples for agent communication and coordination
Teaches context isolation strategies to overcome single-agent limitations
Includes failure mode analysis and mitigation strategies
Offers practical guidance on consensus mechanisms and voting protocols
limitations: Educational content only - requires adaptation for production use
Python examples are simplified implementations, not production-ready
Focuses on architecture patterns, not specific framework implementations
Assumes basic understanding of AI agent concepts

use_cases.title: Design scalable AI systems
use_cases.description: Learn to architect multi-agent systems that handle complex tasks beyond single-agent capabilities

use_cases.title: Implement agent coordination
use_cases.description: Apply proven patterns like supervisor/orchestrator and peer-to-peer for effective agent collaboration

use_cases.title: Compare multi-agent approaches
use_cases.description: Understand trade-offs between different coordination patterns and when to use each

prompt_templates.title: Basic Multi-Agent Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to design a multi-agent system for [task]. What architecture pattern would work best and why?

prompt_templates.title: Supervisor Pattern Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement a supervisor agent that coordinates specialized workers for [specific task]

prompt_templates.title: Context Isolation Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: How can I isolate context between agents while ensuring they have enough information to complete their subtasks?

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a consensus mechanism for multi-agent decisions that avoids sycophancy and handles disagreements

output_examples.input: Design a multi-agent research system that can analyze multiple documents simultaneously
output: Architecture: Supervisor pattern with specialized agents
Agent roles: Researcher (document retrieval), Analyzer (data analysis), Fact-checker (verification), Writer (synthesis)
Context isolation: Each agent maintains focused context for its specialty
Coordination: Supervisor decomposes research task and aggregates results
Failure handling: Circuit breakers prevent cascade failures
Consensus: Weighted voting based on agent confidence scores

output_examples.input: How do I implement agent handoffs in a swarm architecture?
output: Define explicit handoff protocols with state passing
Use function returns to transfer control between agents
Implement message passing for context transfer
Set clear boundaries for each agent's responsibility
Add convergence checks to prevent infinite handoffs

output_examples.input: What are the main failure modes in multi-agent systems?
output: Supervisor bottleneck: Central coordinator saturates under load
Coordination overhead: Agent communication consumes tokens and adds latency
Divergence: Agents drift from objectives without central coordination
Error propagation: Failures cascade through agent dependencies

best_practices: Design for context isolation as the primary benefit, not organizational metaphor
Implement explicit handoff protocols with clear state passing between agents
Use weighted voting or debate protocols to avoid sycophancy in consensus
anti_patterns: Creating agents based on human roles without considering context isolation needs
Using simple majority voting that treats all agent opinions equally
Allowing unlimited context accumulation in supervisors without checkpointing

faq.question: Which frameworks support these multi-agent patterns?
faq.answer: LangGraph, AutoGen, and CrewAI are popular frameworks. The skill provides framework-agnostic patterns.

faq.question: How much do multi-agent systems increase token usage?
faq.answer: Expect approximately 15x baseline token usage, but this enables handling tasks impossible for single agents.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing single-agent systems?
faq.answer: Yes, start by identifying natural decomposition points and gradually introduce specialized agents.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using multiple agents?
faq.answer: The skill teaches local coordination patterns. No external APIs unless you explicitly implement them.

faq.question: What if agents produce conflicting results?
faq.answer: Implement debate protocols and weighted voting. The skill covers consensus mechanisms for disagreements.

faq.question: When should I choose multi-agent over single-agent?
faq.answer: Multi-agent excels at context isolation and parallelization. Single agents are simpler for straightforward tasks.
